title: 3 Easy Ways to Find Your Saved Posts on Facebook

steps.title: Open the Facebook app.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app. This looks like a white f on a blue background. [1] X Research source If you aren't logged into Facebook, enter your email address (or phone number) and password to log in or create a new account . Facebook is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store .

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . On iOS, this will be located at the bottom-right. On Android, you can find this at the top-right. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Saved.
steps.content: Tap Saved . You can find this on the right side, underneath Marketplace . [3] X Research source

steps.title: View your saved posts.
steps.content: View your saved posts. Tap See All to see all your saved posts. Scroll up and down to view the posts, or tap All in the top-right corner to sort by: Uncategorized, Links, Videos, or Photos. If you have existing collections, you can find them at the bottom of the Saved page. Tap a collection to view the saved posts within it. To create a new collection, tap Create to the right of Collections . Enter a collection name, select who can see the collection, then tap Create . Tap Add items to add saved posts to a collection.

steps.title: Go to https://www.facebook.com/saved/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.facebook.com/saved/ in a web browser. This is the direct link to access your Facebook's Saved page. If you prefer to navigate from the homepage, click Saved in the left sidebar. [4] X Research source If you're not already logged in, enter your login details to do so now. You can reset your password if needed.

steps.title: View your saved posts.
steps.content: View your saved posts. Your saved posts will be listed underneath the All header. Scroll up and down to view the posts, or tap the icon in the top-right corner to sort by: Links, Videos, Reels, Photos, and more. If you have existing collections, you can find them in the left panel. Click a collection to view the posts saved within it. To create a new collection, click + Create New Collection on the left panel. Enter a name, then click Create . To add posts to a collection, tap Add to Collection underneath the post, then select the collection. If you want to share a post , click the three dots icon in the top-right corner of the post and click Share .

steps.title: Open Facebook or go to https://www.facebook.com/.
steps.content: Open Facebook or go to https://www.facebook.com/ . You can use either the website or mobile app to save posts for later. Log in if prompted.

steps.title: Navigate to a post you want to save.
steps.content: Navigate to a post you want to save. You can pick a post from your News Feed or a post from a page to save.

steps.title: Click or tap ••• .
steps.content: Click or tap ••• . You'll find this in the top right corner of the post. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click or tap Save Post/Video/Event/Link.
steps.content: Click or tap Save Post/Video/Event/Link . If you are saving a post with a video, you'll see the option to Save Video . If you're saving a post with an event, you'll see the option to Save Event . [6] X Research source

steps.title: Select the collection you'd like to save the post in.
steps.content: Select the collection you'd like to save the post in. Facebook now requires you to set a collection you'd like to save the post to. If you're saving for the first time, Facebook may start a collection called "For Later".
